newsitem.title: KAZAKHSTAN: Kazakh savings bond subscription to begin Sept 11.
newsitem.headline: Kazakh savings bond subscription to begin Sept 11.

text.p: Subscription to the first tranche of a 1.3 billion tenge ($19.0 million) Kazakh national savings bond (NSO) will open to individuals on September 11 to 20, finance minister Alexander Pavlov said on Wednesday.

Unsubscribed bonds from the 300 million tenge ($4.4 million) first tranche will be offered to foreign and domestic firms after registration for individuals ends and the tranche will be issued on September 26, he told a news conference.

Officials said quarterly interest would be paid on the 364-day bond based on yields on Kazakh three-month GKO discount treasury bill. A September 3 GKO issue had a 26.39 percent annualised interest rate.
The nominal value of the savings bonds is 1,000 tenge ($0.02).
